CalendarEvents.Name: SPEAK MPLS Orientation (Northeast)
CalendarEvents.ShortDescription: Welcome to SPEAK MPLS! During this orientation, you will tour the SPEAK MPLS Northeast studio and learn all about the benefits of membership.
CalendarEvents.LongDescription:
EVENT DESCRIPTION

Join us for an in-person orientation at one of the SPEAK MPLS studios to jump-start your media journey! Learn about membership benefits, how to submit content to air on TV, and ways to access the tools to fully engage and thrive in the SPEAK MPLS creative community. You’ll tour the studio and see equipment available to members, so pick the location nearest you! Orientation is required for all members. If additional times or virtual options are needed, please reach out and we can accommodate you.


ADDITIONAL DETAILS

Registration closes on Tuesday, September 24th at 9pm.

This event is one hour in length, free and open to the public.

This in-person event will be held at the SPEAK MPLS Northeast studio, located within the Waterbury Building at 1121 Jackson Street NE Studio #128, Minneapolis, MN 55413. The Waterbury, a large, red building, is located near the corner of Broadway St. NE and Central Ave. NE in the Northeast Minneapolis Arts District.

Please contact SPEAK MPLS’ Community Media Manager James Harris at james@speakmpls.com with accommodation requests or if you have additional questions.
CalendarEvents.VenueAddress: 1121 Jackson Street NE, Suite 128, Minneapolis MN 55413

ChepeastProduct.Name: SPEAK MPLS Orientation (Northeast)
ChepeastProduct.Description: Welcome to SPEAK MPLS! During this orientation, you will tour the SPEAK MPLS Northeast studio and learn all about the benefits of membership. Participants will explore the history of public access TV, our community media opportunities, and SPEAK MPLS policies and procedures.

Resource.Name: SPEAK MPLS Northeast- Production Studio
Resource.Description:
Our 30x40 production studio with 14’ high ceilings is equipped with three HD cameras, live streaming capabilities, floor LED lighting, audio snake for microphones, and a kitchenette.


CAMERAS & TRIPODS

(3) JVC HM600U
(2) Vinten Vision Pedestal
(1) Vinten Vision BlueLIGHTING
(2) Aputure Nova P300c
(1) Aputure LS 600d
(1) Aputure MC 12-Light Production Kit
(2) Aputure LS300X, BI-COLOR
(1) APUTURE 19 DEG SPOT LENS SET
(1) APUTURE 36 DEG SPOT LENS SET
(1) 4 BANK- Quasar Science 4FT/T12 50W CROSSFADE LED
Various flags, silks, diffusion, and frames


AUDIO

(1) Behringer X32 Mixer
(4) Movo LV8-D Lavalier
(6) Shure SM58 Handheld
(6) Sennheiser XS Wireless Handheld
(4) Sennheiser MKE600
25’ and 50’ 3-Pin XLR Cables


GRIP/MISC

(6) C-Stands
(8) Sandbags
(3) White set walls
A wide range of seamless backdrop paper colors

-----

The SPEAK MPLS production studio is located in the Waterbury Building in the Northeast Minneapolis Arts District at the intersection of Broadway and Central Avenues.

Ample lot parking is available in both the front and back of the building.

Bookings for this community media service are limited to 4 hours maximum. 

2 hour minimum booking required which includes setup and cleanup.


Hours of Operation:

Wednesday: 12pm - 5pm
Friday: 12pm - 8pm
Saturday: 12pm - 4pm

CalendarEvents.Name: Media Literacy
CalendarEvents.ShortDescription: Join us for a workshop about media literacy through a journalistic lens, with an emphasis on relevant local storytelling, community representation, and navigating a complex media ecosystem.
CalendarEvents.LongDescription:
CLASS DESCRIPTION

Join us for a workshop about media literacy through a journalistic lens, with an emphasis on relevant local storytelling, community representation, and navigating a complex media ecosystem.

Participants will develop a critical understanding of media literacy, focusing on how journalism shapes narratives, represents communities, and navigates the complexities of today's media ecosystem. This workshop will empower participants to analyze media content critically and create relevant local stories that reflect their communities.


DETAILS

Registration closes on Thursday, September 26th at 9:00pm.

$30 for non-members / $15 for SPEAK MPLS members

This in-person class will be held at the SPEAK MPLS Northeast studio, located within the Waterbury Building at 1121 Jackson Street NE Studio #128, Minneapolis, MN 55413. The Waterbury, a large, red building, is located near the corner of Broadway St. NE and Central Ave. NE in the Northeast Minneapolis Arts District.


INSTRUCTOR + BIO

A resident of the Lowry Hill East neighborhood in Minneapolis, Eric Ortiz has extensive experience in journalism, community building, and social justice innovation with for-profit and nonprofit organizations. He oversees all community programming and operations for the Strong Mind Strong Body Foundation, creating curriculums and leading community programs that empower youth to build leadership skills and increase educational and economic opportunities. He develops and manages partnerships with schools, businesses, and community groups to provide educational programs and resources. Eric also is a longtime journalist and the former founder of Evrybit, a citizen journalism app startup and mobile storytelling platform that democratized community journalism.


CLASS REGISTRATION, ATTENDANCE, CANCELLATION + OTHER POLICIES

- Class schedules and registration information are available at www.speakmpls.com. 

- Once registered, participants will receive an email confirmation with directions and parking information for the SPEAK MPLS Northeast studio.

- Please arrive on time. The instructor will begin at the start of class.

- In the event that a class must be canceled, SPEAK MPLS will contact registered participants with as much notification as possible, to either reschedule or refund the cost of the class.

- A participant may cancel a class by providing written notice of cancellation to SPEAK MPLS’ Director of Education James Harris at james@speakmpls.com within 48-hours of the scheduled class. Participants may have a one-time option to reschedule the class at no additional cost.  If a participant fails to attend the rescheduled class, no refunds for class fee will be granted.  If the class was a one-on-one class, the instructor has the discretion to reschedule based on the instructor’s availability.

- If participants have financial challenges to pay for membership or classes, SPEAK MPLS offers a sliding scale fee. Please contact info@speakmpls.com for application information. Once we have received the application, a SPEAK MPLS team member will be in touch within 10 business days of receipt of the application.

- Participants are expected to follow the SPEAK MPLS Policies, as defined in Chapter 4 of the Member Playbook.  Instructors and SPEAK MPLS staff reserve the right to dismiss any participant from a class for violation of SPEAK MPLS Policies.


CONTACT US

If you have any questions or concerns, please contact SPEAK MPLS’ Director of Education James Harris at 612-208-7215 or james@speakmpls.com with accommodation requests or if you have additional questions.
CalendarEvents.VenueAddress: 1121 Jackson Street NE, Suite 128, Minneapolis MN 55413

CalendarEvents.Name: Create Content: Power in your Pocket
CalendarEvents.ShortDescription: Elevate your content creation skills and produce captivating content that stands out online! In the Create Content: Power in your Pocket class, we'll share techniques and DIY tips for self-producing videos, walk through how to plan for your production, and show you how it all comes together using the phone in your pocket!
CalendarEvents.LongDescription:
CLASS DESCRIPTION

Elevate your content creation skills and produce captivating content that stands out online! In the Create Content: Power in your Pocket class, we'll share techniques and DIY tips for self-producing videos, walk through how to plan for your production, and show you how it all comes together using the phone in your pocket!

 

DETAILS

Registration closes on Wednesday, October 9th at 9pm.

$60 for non-members / $30 for SPEAK MPLS members

This in-person class will be held at the SPEAK MPLS South studio, located at 2429 Nicollet Ave, Minneapolis, MN 55404. Street parking is available along Nicollet Ave. When you arrive, please use the Ring doorbell and a staff member will come let you in. You can also call us when you arrive at 612-208-7215.

 

INSTRUCTOR + BIO

Destiny, a Saint Paul native, is a seasoned cinematographer, entrepreneur, and artist with over 13 years of extensive experience in media creation. As the owner of a thriving business for the past 6 years, Destiny has demonstrated her prowess not only behind the camera but also in the world of entrepreneurship. Her passion lies in storytelling through various forms of media content creation. Beyond her work in cinematography, Destiny is a multifaceted artist, doubling as a recording musician. Additionally, she is the creative force behind her own clothing line. Destiny's commitment to artistic expression and business acumen sets her apart as a dynamic force in both the creative and entrepreneurial realms.

 

INTRODUCTORY LEVEL CLASS

This class is perfect for beginners and open to all skill levels! SPEAK MPLS is your community media home. We offer introductory level classes for anyone that has a story to share. Dive deep into your media journey by joining one of our monthly cohorts and implementing our industry‘s best practices. 

 

CLASS REGISTRATION, ATTENDANCE, CANCELLATION + OTHER POLICIES

- Class schedules and registration information are available at www.speakmpls.com. 

- Once registered, participants will receive an email confirmation with directions and parking information for the SPEAK MPLS South studio.

- Please join the class on time. The instructor will begin at the start of class.

- In the event that a class must be canceled, SPEAK MPLS will contact registered participants with as much notification as possible, to either reschedule or refund the cost of the class.

- A participant may cancel a class by providing written notice of cancellation to SPEAK MPLS’ Director of Education James Harris at james@speakmpls.com within 48-hours of the scheduled class. Participants may have a one-time option to reschedule the class at no additional cost.  If a participant fails to attend the rescheduled class, no refunds for class fee will be granted.  If the class was a one-on-one class, the instructor has the discretion to reschedule based on the instructor’s availability.

- If participants have financial challenges to pay for membership or classes, SPEAK MPLS offers a sliding scale fee. Please contact info@speakmpls.com for application information. Once we have received the application, a SPEAK MPLS team member will be in touch within 10 business days of receipt of the application.

- Participants are expected to follow the SPEAK MPLS Policies, as defined in Chapter 4 of the Member Playbook.  Instructors and SPEAK MPLS staff reserve the right to dismiss any participant from a class for violation of SPEAK MPLS Policies.

 

CONTACT US

If you have any questions or concerns, please contact SPEAK MPLS’ Director of Education James Harris at 612-208-7215 or james@speakmpls.com with accommodation requests or if you have additional questions.

CalendarEvents.Name: 40th Anniversary Party
CalendarEvents.ShortDescription: Minneapolis is about to reach a media milestone as public access TV is about to hit the massive 40-year mark! As we do in the land of 10,000 Lakes when we reach a milestone, we party!
CalendarEvents.LongDescription: Minneapolis is about to reach a media milestone as public access TV is about to hit the massive 40-year mark! As we do in the land of 10,000 Lakes when we reach a milestone, we party! Join SPEAK MPLS and cable access legends and luminaries old and new for a timeless celebration and look back on all that Minneapolis public access TV has had to offer! From the unfiltered voices of Minneapolis residents to decades of diverse music, to the faces that have become some of the brightest stars in the Twin Cities’ sky, we’ll toast to them all and celebrate the bright future of community media! Make some memories and be a part of a time capsule, forever capturing this wonderful landmark moment. 5-8PM at the SPEAK MPLS Northeast Studio at 1121 Jackson Street NE #128 in the Waterbury Building and live on Comcast Xfinity channels 16, 17 and 75 in Minneapolis and streaming at speakmpls.com/watch.
CalendarEvents.VenueAddress: 1121 Jackson Street NE, Suite 128, Minneapolis MN 55413

CalendarEvents.Name: LIVE on Set
CalendarEvents.ShortDescription: Join a fun and creative group of learners where you’ll master the skills of 3-camera studio video production, lighting and sound setup, and LIVE broadcasting from the SPEAK MPLS Northeast studio! In this spooky edition of LIVE on Set, place yourself into your favorite scary movie scenes using green screen effects!
CalendarEvents.LongDescription:
CLASS DESCRIPTION

There are so many directions you can go with content creation! Want to start your own TV show? Have you been wanting some behind-the-scenes TV action? Get hands-on studio experience with a creative cohort. In this class, you’ll learn 4K video camera settings, how to set up lighting and audio and go LIVE from the SPEAK MPLS Northeast studio! In this spooky edition of LIVE on Set, place yourself into your favorite scary movie scenes using green screen effects! 

In this class, you will use our three 4K studio cameras to stage a production and become familiar with the camera settings. You’ll practice framing for ideal shots and set up Aputure studio lighting. The SPEAK MPLS Northeast studio is equipped with OBS, a free software for video recording and streaming. We’ll share best practices for audio recording with a mixing board and then explore live streaming. By the time you leave, you’ll understand the different studio production roles and walk away with the skills feeling confident to create great content!


DETAILS

Registration closes on Tuesday, October 29th at 9:00pm.

$60 for non-members / $30 for SPEAK MPLS members

This in-person class will be held at the SPEAK MPLS Northeast studio, located within the Waterbury Building at 1121 Jackson Street NE Studio #128, Minneapolis, MN 55413. The Waterbury, a large, red building, is located near the corner of Broadway St. NE and Central Ave. NE in the Northeast Minneapolis Arts District.


INSTRUCTORS + BIO

James Harris is the Director of Education at SPEAK MPLS and is a media maker, storyteller, and educator with nearly a decade of experience working in community media. He is passionate about bringing voices together to creatively tell stories. As a media maker and member of the LGBTQ+ community, he strongly believes that media is a powerful tool for sharing experiences and healing. James is also energized by creating opportunities for youth to use media to tell their own stories. In his spare time, James enjoys playing video games, watching horror movies, and playing Dungeons and Dragons!

Vageesha is a recent graduate from the University of Minnesota, with degrees in film and communications. He has numerous years of experience working within the greater Minneapolis-St. Paul community as a videographer and media specialist, supporting important non-profit causes as well as some for-profit ventures. He is interested in the importance of media, and its power to craft narratives and culture for those disadvantaged communities whose voices may not be usually heard.


INTRODUCTORY LEVEL CLASS

This class is perfect for beginners and open to all skill levels! SPEAK MPLS is your community media home. We offer four introductory level classes for anyone that has a story to share. Dive deep into your media journey by joining one of our monthly cohorts and implementing our industry‘s best practices. 

Kick-start your production journey with the "Writer’s Room." Design your studio production from start to finish in "LIVE On Set." Take your project on-the-go during "In The Field." Finalize your story and share it with Minneapolis in the "Edit Lab." With these classes, you’ll gain the skills and reference resources for a successful production experience.


CLASS REGISTRATION, ATTENDANCE, CANCELLATION + OTHER POLICIES

- Class schedules and registration information are available at www.speakmpls.com. 

- Once registered, participants will receive an email confirmation with directions and parking information for the SPEAK MPLS Northeast studio.

- Please arrive on time. The instructor will begin at the start of class.

- In the event that a class must be canceled, SPEAK MPLS will contact registered participants with as much notification as possible, to either reschedule or refund the cost of the class.

- A participant may cancel a class by providing written notice of cancellation to SPEAK MPLS’ Director of Education James Harris at james@speakmpls.com within 48-hours of the scheduled class. Participants may have a one-time option to reschedule the class at no additional cost.  If a participant fails to attend the rescheduled class, no refunds for class fee will be granted.  If the class was a one-on-one class, the instructor has the discretion to reschedule based on the instructor’s availability.

- If participants have financial challenges to pay for membership or classes, SPEAK MPLS offers a sliding scale fee. Please contact info@speakmpls.com for application information. Once we have received the application, a SPEAK MPLS team member will be in touch within 10 business days of receipt of the application.

- Participants are expected to follow the SPEAK MPLS Policies, as defined in Chapter 4 of the Member Playbook.  Instructors and SPEAK MPLS staff reserve the right to dismiss any participant from a class for violation of SPEAK MPLS Policies.


CONTACT US

If you have any questions or concerns, please contact SPEAK MPLS’ Director of Education James Harris at 612-208-7215 or james@speakmpls.com with accommodation requests or if you have additional questions.

CalendarEvents.Name: In the Field
CalendarEvents.ShortDescription: Learn what it takes to bring your storytelling on-location using our field production kits. As we approach the Winter season, join us for tips and tricks on recording in cold conditions in this chilly edition of In the Field!
CalendarEvents.LongDescription:
CLASS DESCRIPTION

SPEAK MPLS knows that filming in the field can be unpredictable. Do you want tips and tricks for using cameras in the field on your own? Learn what it takes to bring your storytelling on-location using our field production kits. As we approach the Winter season, join us for tips and tricks on recording in cold conditions in this chilly edition of In the Field! 

You will get hands-on experience with the SPEAK MPLS field production kit, and a toolkit for how to plan and execute a video production outside of the studio.  You’ll work in a small cohort to practice with handheld 4K JVC cameras, wireless microphones, tripods, LED lights and C-Stands. 

You’ll walk away with a confidence in using the SPEAK MPLS field production kit outside of the studio, and the tools to approach various field conditions and situations.


DETAILS

Registration closes on Friday, November 8th at 9pm.

$60 for non-members / $30 for SPEAK MPLS members

This in-person class will be held at the SPEAK MPLS Northeast studio, located within the Waterbury Building at 1121 Jackson Street NE Studio #128, Minneapolis, MN 55413. The Waterbury, a large, red building, is located near the corner of Broadway St. NE and Central Ave. NE in the Northeast Minneapolis Arts District.


INSTRUCTORS + BIOS

James Harris is the Director of Education at SPEAK MPLS and is a media maker, storyteller, and educator with nearly a decade of experience working in community media. He is passionate about bringing voices together to creatively tell stories. As a media maker and member of the LGBTQ+ community, he strongly believes that media is a powerful tool for sharing experiences and healing. James is also energized by creating opportunities for youth to use media to tell their own stories. In his spare time, James enjoys playing video games, watching horror movies, and playing Dungeons and Dragons!

Vageesha is a recent graduate from the University of Minnesota, with degrees in film and communications. He has numerous years of experience working within the greater Minneapolis-St. Paul community as a videographer and media specialist, supporting important non-profit causes as well as some for-profit ventures. He is interested in the importance of media, and its power to craft narratives and culture for those disadvantaged communities whose voices may not be usually heard.


INTRODUCTORY LEVEL CLASS

This class is perfect for beginners and open to all skill levels! SPEAK MPLS is your community media home. We offer four introductory level classes for anyone that has a story to share. Dive deep into your media journey by joining one of our monthly cohorts and implementing our industry‘s best practices. 

Kick-start your production journey with the "Writer’s Room." Design your studio production from start to finish in "LIVE On Set." Take your project on-the-go during "In The Field." Finalize your story and share it with Minneapolis in the "Edit Lab." With these classes, you’ll gain the skills and reference resources for a successful production experience.


CLASS REGISTRATION, ATTENDANCE, CANCELLATION + OTHER POLICIES

- Class schedules and registration information are available at www.speakmpls.com. 

- Once registered, participants will receive an email confirmation with directions and parking information for the SPEAK MPLS Northeast studio.

- Please arrive on time. The instructor will begin at the start of class.

- In the event that a class must be canceled, SPEAK MPLS will contact registered participants with as much notification as possible, to either reschedule or refund the cost of the class.

- A participant may cancel a class by providing written notice of cancellation to SPEAK MPLS’ Director of Education James Harris at james@speakmpls.com within 48-hours of the scheduled class. Participants may have a one-time option to reschedule the class at no additional cost.  If a participant fails to attend the rescheduled class, no refunds for class fee will be granted.  If the class was a one-on-one class, the instructor has the discretion to reschedule based on the instructor’s availability.

- If participants have financial challenges to pay for membership or classes, SPEAK MPLS offers a sliding scale fee. Please contact info@speakmpls.com for application information. Once we have received the application, a SPEAK MPLS team member will be in touch within 10 business days of receipt of the application.

- Participants are expected to follow the SPEAK MPLS Policies, as defined in Chapter 4 of the Member Playbook. Instructors and SPEAK MPLS staff reserve the right to dismiss any participant from a class for violation of SPEAK MPLS Policies.


CONTACT US

If you have any questions or concerns, please contact SPEAK MPLS’ Director of Education James Harris at 612-208-7215 or james@speakmpls.com with accommodation requests or if you have additional questions.

CalendarEvents.Name: Podcasting
CalendarEvents.ShortDescription: Create your dream podcast from ideation to distribution using joystick cameras, app-controlled lighting, and podcast microphones. Learn what it takes to be an effective host in this new edition of Podcasting!
CalendarEvents.LongDescription:
CLASS DESCRIPTION

Create your dream podcast from ideation to distribution using joystick cameras, app-controlled lighting, and podcast microphones. Learn what it takes to be an effective host in this new edition of Podcasting! 

In this class, you’ll learn how to bring your podcast idea to life alongside a small cohort, practice tips and tricks for engaging with listeners, add a visual component using PTZ cameras, then package and distribute your show.

 

DETAILS

Registration closes on Monday, November 11th at 9:00pm.

$60 for non-members / $30 for SPEAK MPLS members

This in-person class will be held at the SPEAK MPLS South studio, located at 2429 Nicollet Ave, Minneapolis, MN 55404. Street parking is available along Nicollet Ave. When you arrive, please use the Ring doorbell and a staff member will come let you in. You can also call us when you arrive at 612-208-7215.

 

INSTRUCTORS + BIOS

James Harris is the Director of Education at SPEAK MPLS and is a media maker, storyteller, and educator with nearly a decade of experience working in community media. He is passionate about bringing voices together to creatively tell stories. As a media maker and member of the LGBTQ+ community, he strongly believes that media is a powerful tool for sharing experiences and healing. James is also energized by creating opportunities for youth to use media to tell their own stories. In his spare time, James enjoys playing video games, watching horror movies, and playing Dungeons and Dragons!

Vageesha is a recent graduate from the University of Minnesota, with degrees in film and communications. He has numerous years of experience working within the greater Minneapolis-St. Paul community as a videographer and media specialist, supporting important non-profit causes as well as some for-profit ventures. He is interested in the importance of media, and its power to craft narratives and culture for those disadvantaged communities whose voices may not be usually heard.

 

INTRODUCTORY LEVEL CLASS

This class is perfect for beginners and open to all skill levels! SPEAK MPLS is your community media home. We offer four introductory level classes for anyone that has a story to share. Dive deep into your media journey by joining one of our monthly cohorts and implementing our industry‘s best practices. 

Kick-start your production journey with the "Writer’s Room." Design your studio production from start to finish in "LIVE on Set." Take your project on-the-go during "In The Field." Finalize your story and share it with Minneapolis in the "Edit Lab." With these classes, you’ll gain the skills and reference resources for a successful production experience.

 

CLASS REGISTRATION, ATTENDANCE, CANCELLATION + OTHER POLICIES

- Class schedules and registration information are available at www.speakmpls.com. 

- Once registered, participants will receive an email confirmation with directions and parking information for the SPEAK MPLS South studio.

- Please arrive on time. The instructor will begin at the start of class.

- In the event that a class must be canceled, SPEAK MPLS will contact registered participants with as much notification as possible, to either reschedule or refund the cost of the class.

- A participant may cancel a class by providing written notice of cancellation to SPEAK MPLS’ Director of Education James Harris at james@speakmpls.com within 48-hours of the scheduled class. Participants may have a one-time option to reschedule the class at no additional cost.  If a participant fails to attend the rescheduled class, no refunds for class fee will be granted.  If the class was a one-on-one class, the instructor has the discretion to reschedule based on the instructor’s availability.

- If participants have financial challenges to pay for membership or classes, SPEAK MPLS offers a sliding scale fee. Please contact info@speakmpls.com for application information. Once we have received the application, a SPEAK MPLS team member will be in touch within 10 business days of receipt of the application.

- Participants are expected to follow the SPEAK MPLS Policies, as defined in Chapter 4 of the Member Playbook.  Instructors and SPEAK MPLS staff reserve the right to dismiss any participant from a class for violation of SPEAK MPLS Policies.

 

CONTACT US

If you have any questions or concerns, please contact SPEAK MPLS’ Director of Education James Harris at 612-208-7215 or james@speakmpls.com with accommodation requests or if you have additional questions.

CalendarEvents.Name: SPEAK MPLS Orientation (Northeast)
CalendarEvents.ShortDescription: Welcome to SPEAK MPLS! During this orientation, you will tour the SPEAK MPLS Northeast studio and learn all about the benefits of membership.
CalendarEvents.LongDescription:
EVENT DESCRIPTION

Join us for an in-person orientation at one of the SPEAK MPLS studios to jump-start your media journey! Learn about membership benefits, how to submit content to air on TV, and ways to access the tools to fully engage and thrive in the SPEAK MPLS creative community. You’ll tour the studio and see equipment available to members, so pick the location nearest you! Orientation is required for all members. If additional times or virtual options are needed, please reach out and we can accommodate you.


ADDITIONAL DETAILS

Registration closes on Tuesday, November 12th at 9pm.

This event is one hour in length, free and open to the public.

This in-person event will be held at the SPEAK MPLS Northeast studio, located within the Waterbury Building at 1121 Jackson Street NE Studio #128, Minneapolis, MN 55413. The Waterbury, a large, red building, is located near the corner of Broadway St. NE and Central Ave. NE in the Northeast Minneapolis Arts District.

Please contact SPEAK MPLS’ Director of Education James Harris at james@speakmpls.com with accommodation requests or if you have additional questions.

CalendarEvents.Name: Writer's Room (Virtual)
CalendarEvents.ShortDescription: Get a jump-start on telling impactful stories in this hands-on workshop where you and a creative cohort will collaboratively develop your story ideas.
CalendarEvents.LongDescription:
CLASS DESCRIPTION

Get a jump-start on telling impactful stories in this hands-on workshop where you and a creative cohort will collaboratively develop your story ideas. It’s easy to get stuck in the early stages of putting together a story, and sometimes it takes a team of support to get it off the ground! 

In this workshop, you’ll work in a small group to outline and narrow down your story ideas. We’ll share tips for effective storytelling, finding your audience, choosing your story structure, and more! You’ll also walk away with additional resources to help you bring your story into the production phase. 

 

DETAILS

Registration closes on Tuesday, December 10th at 9pm.

$60 for non-members / $30 for SPEAK MPLS members

This virtual event will be held online via Zoom. Once registered, participants will receive an email confirmation with additional details on joining the Zoom call.

 

INSTRUCTOR + BIO

Dr. Rachel Raimist is a formerly tenured college professor turned television director who works across genres. She recently directed episodes of the family drama BEL AIR (Peacock), the fantasy THE SPIDERWICK CHRONICLES (Disney+), the musical UP HERE (Hulu) and the soapy drama SEX/LIFE (Netflix). She has also directed beloved episodes of THE SEX LIVES OF COLLEGE GIRLS (HBO Max), WU-TANG: AN AMERICAN SAGA (Hulu), FANTASY ISLAND (Fox), DIARY OF A FUTURE PRESIDENT (Disney+) and others. Raimist holds a B.A. and a M.F.A. in Directing from the UCLA School of Film and Television and a M.A. in Women’s Studies and a Ph.D. in Feminist Studies from the University of Minnesota. At the Directors Guild of America, she serves as the Co-Chair of the Special Projects Committee, Co-Chair of the Disability Committee, the Alternate Co-Chair of the Women's Steering Committee and on the leadership team of the Women's Steering Committee Women Directors Mentorship Program, The Squad. In her free time, she offers low cost classes on the craft and industry of film and television through ThePeoplesFilmSchool.com. 

 

INTRODUCTORY LEVEL CLASS

This class is perfect for beginners and open to all skill levels! SPEAK MPLS is your community media home. We offer four introductory level classes for anyone that has a story to share. Dive deep into your media journey by joining one of our monthly cohorts and implementing our industry‘s best practices. 

Kick-start your production journey with the "Writer’s Room." Design your studio production from start to finish in "LIVE On Set." Take your project on-the-go during "In The Field." Finalize your story and share it with Minneapolis in the "Edit Lab." With these classes, you’ll gain the skills and reference resources for a successful production experience.

 

CLASS REGISTRATION, ATTENDANCE, CANCELLATION + OTHER POLICIES

- Class schedules and registration information are available at www.speakmpls.com. 

- This virtual event will be held online via Zoom. Once registered, participants will receive an email confirmation with additional details on joining the Zoom call.

- In the event that a class must be canceled, SPEAK MPLS will contact registered participants with as much notification as possible, to either reschedule or refund the cost of the class.

- A participant may cancel a class by providing written notice of cancellation to SPEAK MPLS’ Director of Education James Harris at james@speakmpls.com within 48-hours of the scheduled class. Participants may have a one-time option to reschedule the class at no additional cost.  If a participant fails to attend the rescheduled class, no refunds for class fee will be granted.  If the class was a one-on-one class, the instructor has the discretion to reschedule based on the instructor’s availability.

- If participants have financial challenges to pay for membership or classes, SPEAK MPLS offers a sliding scale fee. Please contact info@speakmpls.com for application information. Once we have received the application, a SPEAK MPLS team member will be in touch within 10 business days of receipt of the application.

- Participants are expected to follow the SPEAK MPLS Policies, as defined in Chapter 4 of the Member Playbook.  Instructors and SPEAK MPLS staff reserve the right to dismiss any participant from a class for violation of SPEAK MPLS Policies.

 

CONTACT US

If you have any questions or concerns, please contact SPEAK MPLS’ Director of Education James Harris at 612-208-7215 or james@speakmpls.com with accommodation requests or if you have additional questions.

CalendarEvents.Name: Edit Lab
CalendarEvents.ShortDescription: Learn how to put your stories together for sharing with MPLS! In this special edition of Edit Lab, bring in your pictures and videos of friends and family to put together into a virtual moving holiday card!
CalendarEvents.LongDescription:
CLASS DESCRIPTION

Learn how to put your stories together for sharing with MPLS! In this special edition of Edit Lab, bring in your pictures and videos of friends and family to put together into a virtual moving holiday card! Join our Adobe Premiere Pro editing class and master the essentials of timeline organization, audio adjustment, and adding transitions, titles, and effects. 


DETAILS 

Registration closes on Monday, December 16th at 9pm.

$60 for non-members / $30 for SPEAK MPLS members

This in-person class will be held at the SPEAK MPLS South studio, located at 2429 Nicollet Ave, Minneapolis, MN 55404. Street parking is available along Nicollet Ave. When you arrive, please use the Ring doorbell and a staff member will come let you in. You can also call us when you arrive at 612-208-7215.


INSTRUCTOR + BIO

James Harris is the Director of Education at SPEAK MPLS and is a media maker, storyteller, and educator with nearly a decade of experience working in community media. He is passionate about bringing voices together to creatively tell stories. As a media maker and member of the LGBTQ+ community, he strongly believes that media is a powerful tool for sharing experiences and healing. James is also energized by creating opportunities for youth to use media to tell their own stories. In his spare time, James enjoys playing video games, watching horror movies, and playing Dungeons and Dragons!

Vageesha is a recent graduate from the University of Minnesota, with degrees in film and communications. He has numerous years of experience working within the greater Minneapolis-St. Paul community as a videographer and media specialist, supporting important non-profit causes as well as some for-profit ventures. He is interested in the importance of media, and its power to craft narratives and culture for those disadvantaged communities whose voices may not be usually heard.


INTRODUCTORY LEVEL CLASS

This class is perfect for beginners and open to all skill levels! SPEAK MPLS is your community media home. We offer four introductory level classes for anyone that has a story to share. Dive deep into your media journey by joining one of our monthly cohorts and implementing our industry‘s best practices. 

Kick-start your production journey with the "Writer’s Room." Design your studio production from start to finish in "LIVE On Set." Take your project on-the-go during "In The Field." Finalize your story and share it with Minneapolis in the "Edit Lab." With these classes, you’ll gain the skills and reference resources for a successful production experience.


CLASS REQUIREMENTS

The following are requirements for all participants:

- Provide video footage to work on as part of the class. If needed, the instructor will provide footage.

 

CLASS REGISTRATION, ATTENDANCE, CANCELLATION + OTHER POLICIES

- Class schedules and registration information are available at www.speakmpls.com. 

- Once registered, participants will receive an email confirmation with directions and parking information for the SPEAK MPLS South studio.

- Please arrive on time. The instructor will begin at the start of class.

- In the event that a class must be canceled, SPEAK MPLS will contact registered participants with as much notification as possible, to either reschedule or refund the cost of the class.

- A participant may cancel a class by providing written notice of cancellation to SPEAK MPLS’ Director of Education James Harris at james@speakmpls.com within 48-hours of the scheduled class. Participants may have a one-time option to reschedule the class at no additional cost.  If a participant fails to attend the rescheduled class, no refunds for class fee will be granted.  If the class was a one-on-one class, the instructor has the discretion to reschedule based on the instructor’s availability.

- If participants have financial challenges to pay for membership or classes, SPEAK MPLS offers a sliding scale fee. Please contact info@speakmpls.com for application information. Once we have received the application, a SPEAK MPLS team member will be in touch within 10 business days of receipt of the application.

- Participants are expected to follow the SPEAK MPLS Policies, as defined in Chapter 4 of the Member Playbook.  Instructors and SPEAK MPLS staff reserve the right to dismiss any participant from a class for violation of SPEAK MPLS Policies.


CONTACT US

If you have any questions or concerns, please contact SPEAK MPLS at 612-208-7215 or info@speakmpls.com with accommodation requests or if you have additional questions.

Resource.Name: SPEAK MPLS South - Edit Suite
Resource.Description:
The edit suites feature iMacs with quiet keyboards and comes installed with the full Adobe Creative Cloud suite, iMovie, and Final Cut Pro.

Members are required to bring their own editing drives.

Transfer your DVD content to as an editable video file to upload to your digital platforms.

-----

The SPEAK MPLS South edit suites are located on the lower level of the 2429 Building on Nicollet Ave. Street parking is available along Nicollet Ave. When you arrive, please use the Ring doorbell and a staff member will come let you in. You can also call us when you arrive at 612-208-7215.

-----

Bookings for this community media service are limited to 4 hours maximum and must be made during SPEAK MPLS South access hours.

Hours of Operation:

Tuesday: 12 - 5pm
Thursday: 12 - 8pm
